âœ… Most DIY videos nail the basics: check the flapper, adjust the float, inspect the fill valve. These cover 90% of running toilets.

âš ï¸ What they skip: the flush valve seat. If it's corroded or has mineral buildup, a new flapper won't seal properly. Also â€” that hairline crack in the overflow tube? Yeah, that'll keep running forever.

ğŸ’¡ George's Pro Tip: Before replacing anything, put food coloring in the tank. Wait 15 min. If color appears in the bowl without flushing, it's definitely the flapper. Save yourself a trip to the hardware store.
